chapter.title: Security Fundamentals: CIA, Controls, Data Protection

design_intent.player_goal: Master Chapter 1 high-yield exam patterns: CIA/nonrepudiation, control categories vs types, gap analysis, data states, DLP & obfuscation, access restrictions, segmentation vs isolation.

mastery_model.update: Mastery += 8 on first correct; +4 on repeat correct; -6 on wrong (floor 0).

trap_list.name: Category vs Type Confusion
trap_list.fix: Category = mechanism (where/how it acts). Type = intent (what effect).

trap_list.name: Deterrent vs Preventive
trap_list.misconception: Assuming deterrent controls physically stop attacks.
trap_list.fix: Deterrent discourages attempts; preventive blocks/avoids the issue from happening.

trap_list.name: Data State Mix-up
trap_list.misconception: Thinking encryption only matters in transit, or ignoring in-use risk.
trap_list.fix: Protect all three states: at rest, in transit, and in use (memory/processing).

trap_list.name: Segmentation vs Isolation
trap_list.fix: Segmentation = separate networks with controlled communication. Isolation = cut off from outside networks.

trap_list.name: Hashing = Encryption? Nope
trap_list.misconception: Thinking hashing is reversible like encryption.
trap_list.fix: Hashing is one-way; it can still be attacked via guessing/brute force, so use carefully.

missions.name: CIA Calibration
missions.goal: Classify incidents and pick the primary objective(s) at risk (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability, Nonrepudiation).

missions.name: Control Arsenal: Category vs Type
missions.goal: Given a control, label its category (technical/operational/managerial/physical) and its type (preventive/deterrent/detective/corrective/compensating/directive).

missions.name: Data States Gauntlet
missions.goal: Spot which data state is being attacked (at rest / in transit / in use) and pick a fitting protection approach.

missions.name: Stop the Exfil: DLP + Minimization
missions.goal: Defend against data exfiltration using DLP, minimization, obfuscation, and access restrictions.

boss.name: Boss Fight: The Gap Analysis Hydra
boss.premise: You inherit a messy environment: legacy systems, unclear objectives, and a regulator breathing down your neck. Kill the Hydra by finding the gaps and selecting controls that match both category and type.

constraint_cards.name: Budget Cut
constraint_cards.effect: Reduce max control picks by 1 this act.

modes.name: Quickfire Duel
modes.description: Both players answer the same 10 questions. Faster correct answers generate 'attack packets' that add 5s time tax to the opponent's next question.

fairness.matchmaking: match by mastery band (+/- 10 mastery points)
